results.title: The Philadelphia story
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joseph L Mankiewicz and George Cukor
results.brief_description: A wealthy society girl, who is about to marry for the second time, finds she still loves her first husband. Cukor’s direction is so discreet you can hardly sense it. Starring Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant and James Stewart. Based on a play by Philip Barry.

results.title: The Phantom tollbooth
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Chuck Jones and Abe Levitow
results.brief_description: A young boy, (Butch Patrick) dreams away his boredom by entering an animated fantasy world which he enters by driving through the Phantom Tollbooth. In this world letters and numbers are at war with one another, and the boy must rescue two Princesses, Rhyme and Reason who have been exiled to a castle hovering in the sky. Based on Norton Juster’s book, this film is MGM’s first full-length feature cartoon. Voices provided by Mel Blanc, June Foray and Daws Butler

results.title: The Phantom of the opera (1925)
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Carl Laemmle and Rupert Julian
results.brief_description: The cinema classic features the legendary Lon Chaney in one of his finest performances. The famed unmasking sequence is still powerful after all these years, and the final scene of the Phantom restraining the mobs of Paris to protect his true love will linger in the memory. Colour-tinted version with music accompaniment provided by the City of Prague Philharmonic.

results.title: The Phantom of the opera
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, George Waggner and Arthur Lubin
results.brief_description: Gaston Leroux’s classic horror tale stars Claude Rains as the immortal phantom who haunts the Paris Opera. As a crazed composer, he is haunted by the beautiful soprano of the company, (Susanna Foster), and is determined to revenge himself upon those who have stolen his music. Nelson Eddy plays the heroic young baritone who tracks down the disfigured madman who has begun to murder those who resist his demands. The lavish colour production moves to a terrifying climax as the phantom is chased through the catacombs of Paris.

results.title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
results.creator_credit: Ixtlan, Oliver Stone, Janet Yang, Michael Hausman and Milos Forman
results.brief_description: This is the story of the rise and rise of a self-confessed “smut-peddler”, Larry Flynt (Woody Harrelson) and his wife Althea (Courtney Love) and his building of a publishing empire, of which “Hustler” magazine is the figurehead. Along the way Flynt gets dragged to court by several exponent of the religious right, intent on defending the “decent folks”. At every turn, Larry fights back, using a tactic of high antics and retreat behind the “First Amendment”. Courted by the Pentecostal movement and Ruth Carter (Jimmy’s sister) played by Donna Hannover, he finally converts, only to give his campaign for “free speech and porn for all” the overtones of a crusade. The true life story of Larry Flynt is rich in sex, drugs, making money - and an assassination attempt. Who is Larry Flynt: a hedonistic, obnoxious pornograph or or an unlikely freedom of speech campaigner whose ardour is only tamed by drug addiction, mental illness, and Althea’s failing health? This film won two Oscar nominations to Forman and Harrelson. Winner of Golden Bear, Berlin - 1997. Includes cameos by Larry Flynt, James Carville (former Clinton ‘91 campaing director) and Donna Hannover.

results.title: The Pelican brief
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Alan Pakula and Pieter Jan Brugge
results.brief_description: A law student (Julia Roberts) turns her suspicions about the deaths of two Supreme Court Justices into a speculative brief that has the potential to rock the highest levels of government. She and a determined investigative reporter (Denzel Washington) want to expose the scandal to the world, the only challenge is to live to tell the tale. This suspenseful film is based on the best-selling thriller by John Grisham.

results.title: The Pebble and the penguin
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth Productions, Russell Boland and Colin Mawby
results.brief_description: The Full Moon Ceremony, a real-life Adeli Penguin ritual requires that all bachelor penguins present a special pebble to their sweetheart. If she accepts, they are partners for life. Hubie, a shy penguin with a heart of gold, finds a perfect stone to present to his true love Marina. The evil Drake, another admirer casts a plot which sees Hubie expelled from the colony. Luckily as he is cast adrift into the wide world, he meets up with Rocko and together they begin the long journey back home. A life-long friendship develops and at last Hubie gets his girl.

results.title: The Pawnbroker
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, Roger Lewis, Phillip Langner and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: A powerful drama that focuses on Sol Nazerman (Rod Steiger), a middle-aged concentration camp survivor who lost his entire family to the Nazis and now runs a pawnshop in Harlem. His survival is a source of bewilderment and pain which has caused him to take refuge in misery and the condemnation of humanity. He is totally removed from the world of thieves and pimps that frequent his shop and displays no emotional vulnerability to the few people who try to penetrate his icy exterior. When his assistant Ortiz (Jaime Sanchez) sacrifices his own life for Sol during a robbery, the pawnbroker is finally confronted with the inherent goodness of the human spirit. Attacked at the time of its release for being anti-Semitic, anti-Black and pornographic, the film is also memorable for its innovative use of flashbacks to represent the disturbing flashes of Sol’s memory and the soundtrack composed by Quincy Jones. Also stars Geraldine Fitzgerald. Based on the novel by Edward Lewis Wallant.

results.title: The Passion of Joan of Arc = The Passion of Jeanne D'Arc
results.creator_credit: Societe Generale Des Films and Carl Theodor Dreyer
results.brief_description: The script was based on original transcripts of the trial of Jeanne d’Arc, period detail was carefully researched, unusually solid sets were constructed and a monumental performance given by Falconetti as Jeanne. However, it is the films formal rigour which places it in the forefront of experimental film art. Cast includes Renee Falconetti, Antonin Artaud, Michel Simon.
